instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.P5VS0_EN: What is P5VS0_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello there friends...

working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged board
got it cleaned so no visible signs on corrosion..


measuring around the board, appears to be getting 1.04v on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
s3 and s5 are there reading 5.10v

looking at <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> is getting the input on pin 3 from s3 (5.10v) but the en signal seems to be low (around 2.7v)
on <RESISTOR>R8187</RESISTOR> i get 3.29v on 1 and 2.7v on pin 2..

checking this resistor which should be 47k ohm is reading around 17k ohm when it's in circuit
when pulling it out of circuit it's reading correctly 47k so i put it back on..

tried also replacing <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> form a donor board, but still getting the same issue..

short to ground around this area maybe?
any help would be greatly appreciated...

thank you...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message: measuring on the fan connector and also pin 1 on <RESISTOR>R1845</RESISTOR> with the with multimeter on 2000k resistance mode i get 074 (black probe to the fan and the red to ground)...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Lets start over here.

What is voltage on L7560 and L7520? Where was the corrosion?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
on L7520 i get pulsing between 5.08v - 5.11v
on L7560 3.32v on pin1 and pulsing on pin2 2.96-2.99

when i got it there was a little corrosion in the battery connector area
other than that it was pretty clean...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message: It seems like <SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL> is being pulled low. The only thing that can really cause this would be <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> really. What is resistance to GND on this line?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
i can't read resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL>, i think it's 0 (tried from pin 2 of <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> and also from the <CAPACITOR>C8187</CAPACITOR> pin) but didn't get resistance to ground..

is it worth trying to replacing the cap \ resistors on this line? i figure the EN signal will be created by those..
or try another <CHIP>U8080</CHIP>?

thank you sir...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
update:
i replaced <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> again, seems like the one from the donor board was probably no good
like duke said - wasn't pulling the EN signal as it should..

i got the fan spinning and board is back to life!

SOLVED!
thanks to duke and JohnB...!
